articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Wednesday that Israel had eliminated Hamas Gaza chief Mohammad Sinwar, one of its most wanted targets and the younger brother of the deceased group's leader, Yahya Sinwar.
articles.title: Netanyahu says Hamas Gaza chief Mohammad Sinwar has been eliminated

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, James Mackenzie
articles.description: U.N. trucks delivering food to Gaza were stopped and looted overnight, Gaza residents and merchants said on Wednesday, hours after desperate Palestinians overran a distribution site run by a U.S.-backed group trying to start delivering aid.
articles.title: Food trucks in Gaza raided, underscoring aid distribution problems

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's envoy, Keith Kellogg, on Wednesday scolded a top Russian official for stoking fears of World War Three after Trump warned President Vladimir Putin was playing with fire over Ukraine.
articles.title: U.S. scolds Russia for stoking WW3 fears after Trump's 'playing with fire' remark

articles.author: James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's government hit back at growing international pressure over the war in Gaza on Wednesday, amid deepening signs of division over the war at home, 600 days after the Hamas-led attack on October 7, 2023.
articles.title: Israeli government hits back as international pressure over Gaza mounts

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin's conditions for ending the war in Ukraine include a demand that Western leaders pledge in writing to stop enlarging NATO eastwards and lift a chunk of sanctions on Russia.
articles.title: Exclusive: Putin, for Ukraine peace, wants a pledge to halt NATO enlargement, sources say

articles.author: Lizbeth Diaz
articles.description: Sol remembers her first kill for a Mexican cartel: a kidnapping she committed with a handful of other young recruits that twisted into torture and bled into murder. She was 12 years old.
articles.title: How Mexico's cartels recruit children and groom them into killers

articles.author: Khalid Abdelaziz, Eltayeb Siddig
articles.description: Destroyed bridges, blackouts, empty water stations and looted hospitals across Sudan bear witness to the devastating impact on infrastructure from two years of war.
articles.title: Sudan war shatters infrastructure, costly rebuild needed

articles.author: Greg Torode
articles.description: Satellite imagery shows China landed two of its most advanced bombers in the disputed Paracel islands in the South China Sea this month - a gesture that some analysts described as Beijing's latest signalling of its growing military capabilities to rivals.
articles.title: Exclusive: China's most advanced bombers seen on disputed South China Sea island

articles.author: Juliette Jabkhiro
articles.description: A retired French surgeon who sexually abused hundreds of young patients, many of them children, over more than two decades received a 20-year jail sentence on Wednesday, in France's worst ever child abuse case to go to trial.
articles.title: Retired French surgeon gets maximum 20-year sentence for raping young patients

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Trump administration plans to finalize as soon as Wednesday a new written agreement that may form the basis for a potential Gaza ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas, a senior aide told reporters.
articles.title: Trump to float new Gaza ceasefire terms soon, aide says
